buildup.text: When Chinese writing arrived in Japan around the 5th century, Japanese had no writing system of its own.

discovery.text: Japanese assigned both Chinese readings and native Japanese readings to the same characters.

twist.text: Some kanji diverged so much that a Chinese reader and Japanese reader see different meanings in the same symbol.

punchline.text: Japan borrowed China's characters but not the instructions. Chaos followed.
